org.svvrl.goal.core.logic

Class Validity

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.Validity

  • public class Validity
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods for checking the validity of an algebraic expression or a logic formula.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Validity.Result
      This class defines the result of a validity test.

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public static Validity.Result isValid(Logic f)
                               throws UnsupportedException
        Checks if a logic formula is valid.
        Parameters:
        f - a logic formula
        Returns:
        the result of the validity test
        Throws:
        UnsupportedException - if the validity test of f is unsupported

      • isOREValid

        public static Validity.Result isOREValid(ORExpression expr)
                                  throws UnsupportedException
        Returns the result of testing if an ω-regular expression is valid.
        Parameters:
        expr - an ω-regular expression
        Returns:
        the result of testing if the ω-regular expression is valid
        Throws:
        UnsupportedException - if the translation from the ω-regular expression to an equivalent ω-automaton is not supported

      • isQPTLValid

        public static Validity.Result isQPTLValid(QPTL f)
                                   throws UnsupportedException
        Checks if a QPTL formula is valid.
        Parameters:
        f - a QPTL formula
        Returns:
        the result of the validity test
        Throws:
        UnsupportedException - if the default translation algorithm cannot translate f into an automaton whose emptiness can be checked
